title: Implement Focus-Trapped Modal
description: Create a modal dialog that properly traps keyboard focus.
instructions: Build an AccessibleModal widget that: (1) Traps focus within the modal when open, (2) Has a visible focus indicator on interactive elements, (3) Closes when Escape key is pressed, (4) Auto-focuses the first interactive element when opened, (5) Includes proper heading semantics for the title.

hints.text: Use FocusScope with autofocus: true to trap and auto-focus within the modal
Use KeyboardListener to detect Escape key presses
Add autofocus: true to the primary action button, and use Semantics with header: true for the title

commonMistakes.mistake: Not trapping focus within the modal
commonMistakes.consequence: Keyboard users can Tab outside the modal to elements behind it
commonMistakes.correction: Use FocusScope to create a focus boundary that keeps Tab navigation within the modal

commonMistakes.consequence: Users expect Escape to close dialogs, but nothing happens
commonMistakes.correction: Use KeyboardListener to detect Escape key and call the close callback
